result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Likens

records.addlTxt: Letter from DPU; defn has been accepted and contract will terminate 10/19/23

1:35 PM Defendant Christopher J Likens in court.  Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin. CT has colloquy w/ Defn about right to atty. Defn waives right to atty. CT accepts as knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to ct 1. Court accepted def's plea to ct 1 but w/h adjudication and referred def to FOP. Bail continued.

records.addlTxt: Defendant here today at Collections window to apply for county appointed attorney - to return with completed Petition for Counsel, bring along SPD Financial Eligibility Worksheet and provide most recent paystub.
Defendant not eligible for court appointed counsel through Dane County - income over established guideline.

9:02 AM Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher J Likens in court. Defn doesn't qualify for SPD or CDP, working on appeal. Notice given to Defn in court.

Pre-trial conference on August 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.

Trial Judge - Br 12

08:45 AM Defendant appeared.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
